meanings.definition: A group of things of the same kind that are held or tied together
meanings.sent1: She picked a bunches of flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent2: There were bunches of keys on the keychain.
meanings.sent3: The bunches of balloons floated in the air at the party.
meanings.sent4: The bunches of students in the classroom made it lively.
meanings.sent5: The bunches of colorful candies filled the jar to the brim.

meanings.definition: A large number or amount of something
meanings.sent1: He had bunches of toys scattered around his room.
meanings.sent2: There were bunches of people waiting in line for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The bunches of books on the shelf looked overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: She had bunches of ideas for the project.
meanings.sent5: The bunches of stars in the sky twinkled brightly at night.
